poem:
A Timely Prescription

Morning rustles through pages,
tales of hospitals, budgets, 
and promises weighing heavy.

The words of Ed Davey float 
above our breakfasts, 
a plea braided with urgency.

Outside, the sea washes Brighton,
steady, constant, 
reminding us—all things need tending.
